title: Pass command line args as list
body:
### Background
<!-- Provide a concise overview of the rationale behind this change. Include relevant context, prior discussions, or links to related issues. Ensure that the change aligns with the project's overall direction. -->
> Providing a sequence of arguments is generally preferred, as it allows the module to take care of any required escaping and quoting of arguments (e.g. to permit spaces in file names). Unless otherwise stated, it is recommended to pass args as a sequence. If the shell is invoked explicitly, via `shell=True`, it is the application’s responsibility to ensure that all whitespace and metacharacters are quoted appropriately to avoid [shell injection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shell_injection#Shell_injection) vulnerabilities.

### Changes
<!-- Describe the specific, focused change made in this pull request. Detail the modifications clearly and avoid any unrelated or "extra" changes. -->
Now passing command line args as list, not formatted string. No longer setting `shell=True`.
